subject: AI
title: Prompt Engineering for RAG
description: Craft generation prompts that keep the LLM faithful to retrieved context.

hook.text: You retrieve perfect chunks but the LLM ignores them and answers from its training data instead. The retrieval worked â€” the prompt didn't.

buildup.text: The generation prompt must explicitly instruct the model: 'Answer ONLY based on the context below. If the context doesn't contain the answer, say you don't know.'

discovery.text: Structure matters: place the context before the question, use XML tags or clear delimiters to separate context from instructions, and repeat key constraints at the end of the prompt.

twist.text: Even with perfect prompts, models sometimes 'leak' training knowledge into RAG answers. Adding 'Do not use prior knowledge' helps but isn't bulletproof â€” always verify critical outputs.

climax.text: The best RAG prompts are specific, structured, and defensive: they tell the model what to do, how to format it, and what to do when context is insufficient.

punchline.text: The retrieval finds the signal. The prompt determines whether the model listens.

quiz.question: What is a key instruction to include in a RAG generation prompt?
options: Answer only based on the provided context
